title: In the Beginning was the Word
subtitle: When John declares that Jesus is the eternal Logos who created all things

key_verse.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

cards.title: Logos: The Word Philosophers Knew
cards.subtitle: Why John chose this specific word
cards.content:
When John writes 'In the beginning was the LOGOS', he's using a word loaded with meaning for both Jews and Greeks.

üèõÔ∏è FOR GREEK PHILOSOPHERS:

‚Ä¢ Stoics used 'Logos' to describe the rational principle governing the universe
‚Ä¢ Heraclitus (~500 BC) taught that Logos was the ordering force of the cosmos
‚Ä¢ Plato saw it as the bridge between the ideal and material world
‚Ä¢ For them, Logos was an IDEA, a CONCEPT, an IMPERSONAL FORCE

üìú FOR THE JEWS:

‚Ä¢ 'Logos' translates Hebrew 'Dabar' - God's creative Word
‚Ä¢ In Genesis 1, God SPEAKS and creation obeys: 'And God said, Let there be light: and there was light'
‚Ä¢ Psalm 33:6 declares: 'By the word of the LORD were the heavens made'
‚Ä¢ God's Word does NOT return void (Isaiah 55:11)

üí• WHAT JOHN DOES:

John takes this familiar word and INCARNATES it. He declares something scandalous: 'That Logos you debate philosophically, that Dabar who created the universe - HE BECAME FLESH! He has a name! He is Jesus of Nazareth!'

greek_words.meaning: Word, reason, discourse, expression of thought
greek_words.revelation: It's not just 'spoken word' (rhema). It's the complete expression of God's thought, character and will. Jesus IS God's thought expressed in human form.

cards.revelation_key: The Logos is not a philosophy. It's a Person. Not a concept you study; it's Someone you know.

cards.title: The Three Hammer Blows of John 1:1
cards.subtitle: Each phrase destroys a different heresy
cards.content:
John 1:1 contains THREE statements that together form a complete defense of Christ's divinity:

1Ô∏è‚É£ 'IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE WORD' (ƒín archƒì ƒìn ho Logos)

‚Ä¢ 'Was' (ƒìn) = imperfect tense in Greek = continuous existence without beginning
‚Ä¢ Does NOT say 'came to be' or 'was created'
‚Ä¢ Destroys the heresy: 'Christ was the first created being'
‚Ä¢ TRUTH: Christ existed BEFORE the beginning. He is eternal.

2Ô∏è‚É£ 'AND THE WORD WAS WITH GOD' (kai ho Logos ƒìn pros ton Theon)

‚Ä¢ 'Pros' = face to face, in constant intimate relationship
‚Ä¢ Not just 'beside' - it's active communion
‚Ä¢ Destroys the heresy: 'Jesus is just another name for God the Father (modalism)'
‚Ä¢ TRUTH: The Logos is a DISTINCT Person in relationship with the Father.

3Ô∏è‚É£ 'AND THE WORD WAS GOD' (kai Theos ƒìn ho Logos)

‚Ä¢ Does NOT say 'a god' (Arian heresy)
‚Ä¢ Theos without article emphasizes divine NATURE
‚Ä¢ Destroys the heresy: 'Jesus is just a prophet or angel'
‚Ä¢ TRUTH: The Logos shares the SAME divine nature as the Father.

‚ú® SUMMARY:
Jesus is eternally God (verse 1a), distinct in person from the Father (verse 1b), but identical in divine nature (verse 1c).
cards.revelation_key: John isn't writing poetry. He's building a theological fortress that has withstood 2,000 years of attacks.

cards.title: The Echo of Genesis: All Things Were Made by Him
cards.subtitle: John 1:3 - Christ's divine authorship
cards.content:
John 1:3 declares: 'All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.'

üîó THE GENESIS CONNECTION:

John opens his gospel with the SAME words Moses opened the Bible: 'In the beginning'. This is no coincidence. John is saying: 'The one who spoke in Genesis 1 and created the universe is the same one now walking through Galilee'.

Genesis 1:
‚Ä¢ 'And God said, Let there be light' ‚Üí The Word (Logos) SPEAKS
‚Ä¢ 'And there was light' ‚Üí Creation OBEYS
‚Ä¢ 10 times it says 'And God said' ‚Üí 10 creative acts by the Word

John 1:
‚Ä¢ 'All things were made by him' ‚Üí Jesus is the Creative Agent
‚Ä¢ 'Without him was not ANY THING made that was made' ‚Üí Absolute emphasis

üìä THE TRIPLE STRUCTURE:

John uses three phrases to eliminate all doubt:
1. 'All things' (panta) = EVERYTHING without exception
2. 'Were made by him' (di autou egeneto) = He is the Agent
3. 'Without him NOTHING... was made' = Negative statement for reinforcement

üí° DEVASTATING IMPLICATION:

If Christ created ALL things, then:
‚Ä¢ Angels were created by Him (including Satan)
‚Ä¢ Time was created by Him (He transcends time)
‚Ä¢ Matter was created by Him (He's not limited by physical laws)
‚Ä¢ YOU were created by Him (He designed you with purpose)

scripture_connections.text: For by him were all things created... all things were created by him, and for him
By whom also he made the worlds

cards.revelation_key: The carpenter from Nazareth who walked dusty Galilee is the same one who hung the galaxies in space. He created you, and only He can recreate you.

cards.title: The Life was the Light of Men
cards.subtitle: John 1:4-5 - The eternal conflict
cards.content:
John continues: 'In him was life; and the life was the light of men. And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.'

üî¶ LIFE = LIGHT:

John connects two concepts:
‚Ä¢ Life (zoƒì) = not biological life (bios), but ETERNAL life, God's life
‚Ä¢ Light (ph≈çs) = revelation, truth, God's presence

Where Christ is, there is LIFE. And where there is life, there's LIGHT that exposes darkness.

‚öîÔ∏è THE CONFLICT:

'The darkness comprehended it not' - the Greek verb (katelaben) has double meaning:
1. 'Comprehend' - darkness did NOT UNDERSTAND the light
2. 'Overcome' - darkness could NOT EXTINGUISH the light

Both meanings are intentional. Darkness:
‚Ä¢ Cannot comprehend light (they're incompatible)
‚Ä¢ Cannot extinguish light (it's powerless)

üåç HISTORICAL APPLICATION:

‚Ä¢ Herod tried to kill baby Jesus ‚Üí FAILED
‚Ä¢ Pharisees tried to trap Him in His words ‚Üí FAILED
‚Ä¢ Romans tried to execute Him ‚Üí He rose on the third day
‚Ä¢ Satan tried to destroy the church for 2,000 years ‚Üí STILL HERE

Light ALWAYS overcomes darkness. There's no real battle; only exposure.
cards.identity_statement: You are a carrier of the Light that darkness cannot comprehend or overcome. In your darkest moments, the Light in you is stronger than the darkness around.
cards.revelation_key: Darkness is not light's equal opposite. It's simply light's ABSENCE. When Christ enters, darkness automatically flees.

discovery_questions.question: The Logos who created galaxies personally designed you. What area of your life needs the Creator to RECREATE it from nothing (ex nihilo)?
If Christ is the Logos - the complete expression of God's thought - what does it tell you about the Father's heart toward you that Jesus came as a vulnerable baby?
In what area of your life do you feel 'darkness' is winning? How does it change your perspective to know that light ALWAYS overcomes, not by fighting, but simply by being present?

prayer.title: Prayer of the Logos
prayer.content: Jesus, my eternal Logos. You existed before 'the beginning', created all things, and now live in me. Thank You that You're not a philosophy I must understand, but a Person I can know. Today I ask You to speak order over the chaos of my life, as You did in Genesis 1. May Your light in me expose and overcome every darkness. Remind me that the same power that hung the stars lives within me, and that no darkness can prevail against Your light. In the Jesus name, In the Jesus name, Amen.
